Not sure if that's yours, but here is another one:

https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/SHIRO-901

I'm already working on this one, the only place we are using logback is on the hasher tool unit test:

https://github.com/apache/shiro/blob/main/tools/hasher/src/test/java/org/apache/shiro/tools/hasher/HasherTest.java

OK, I won't notify you again about this release, but will get in touch when a new version is available. If you'd rather skip all updates until the next major or minor version, let me know by commenting `@dependabot ignore this major version` or `@dependabot ignore this minor version`. You can also ignore all major, minor, or patch releases for a dependency by adding an [`ignore` condition](https://docs.github.com/en/code-security/supply-chain-security/configuration-options-for-dependency-updates#ignore) with the desired `update_types` to your config file.

If you change your mind, just re-open this PR and I'll resolve any conflicts on it.

> We also need to remove the logback.xml file in main resource and replace it by a log4j2 default config file

Please check if the config works for you (by executing the app manually, for example). Thanks for pointing me to this oversight! 👍🏻
@dependabot rebase
@rzo1 could you try to make this work for main? It's currently targeted to 1.11.x.
@cstamas is right. A one-class dependency is probably an overkill for most users. I will suggest to drop it completely, so this becomes a `won't fix`.
I would love to see an issue here (type: task or so) and a small description of what fails and why it cannot resolve older ehcache deps and why this is the solution. 😃
Will rebase for 1.x though

> 90 days? Maybe a year is more appropriate? I am not quite sure.. but leave it up to you :)

The default is 60 days! If we are constantly re-opening issues, I will happily change it! :)
Should we add a test for SpringBoot?
https://github.com/dependabot recreate

> Should we add a test for SpringBoot?

I'm trying to add a sample module but I need to go deeper to exclude spring5 vs spring6 and springboot2 vs springboot3.
May be it can be another PR?

We have this in another ASF project:

https://github.com/apache/eventmesh/tree/master/.github/ISSUE_TEMPLATE

I think we can reuse it

I created https://github.com/flowlogix/shiro-springboot3-demo which works with the upcoming Shiro 2.0.0-alpha-3 or later
Once Shiro 2-alpha-3 is released, please use https://github.com/flowlogix/shiro-springboot3-demo as example code with SpringBoot 3 and above
Contributions are welcome :) Thank you
Let me see what I can do.
I also created a new example in Shiro: https://github.com/apache/shiro/tree/main/samples/spring-boot-3-web that uses Spring Boot 3

Superseded by #1002

Hi! 😄 
I'm new in this world of Open Source contributions, and I think this could be my good first issue.
May I help you adding the issue templates for this project?
Sure!  All help is appreciated
Thanks! I added new issue templates based on the eventmesh templates mentioned before. I did not add the unit testing template because I did not find any info about it in the website.
@bmarwell is it ok with what you had in mind?

> @bmarwell is it ok with what you had in mind?

It's a great start!

I would say to merge this "as is" and then update it when we figure out what the exact copy should read.
WDYT?

@lprimak 
I could commit the modifications I made in the environment field, and It could be merged and modified later as you mentioned.
Just a warning, if we want to enable checkstyle, we could have a lot of code source update to do.
@bmarwell What do you think?
Yes, please change accordingly.
We can add -processing as a start

Done!
I modified the environment field to be a text field, and added the fields to explain what was the actual and expected outcome.

Hi, guys!
I'm new in this world of Java, but I would like to keep contributing  to this project.
If you guide through this issue, I am willing to learn and do the research to help in this project. :D
@EdgarRamirezFuentes thanks for your first contribution!

Hi @EdgarRamirezFuentes 

Probably an `inherit` parameter is enough between the version and the config right here: https://github.com/apache/shiro/blob/main/pom.xml#L543-L546

But haven't looked into it, as I am in a rush right now.

If it works, you should get a message that checkstyle was executed for every module when running `mvn verify` on Shiro. It will probably break something too.

If you get to that point, create the PR and point out what did break and why. If there's just small fixes needed (eg whitespace changes), just do a second commit with the fixes. In any other case, we *might* want to exclude some modules from checking or just do a big "fix up all" commit and add it to [a special ignore file](https://docs.github.com/en/repositories/working-with-files/using-files/viewing-a-file#ignore-commits-in-the-blame-view). Yes, the commit to that file needs to be a separate one. :) 

HTH to get you started!

You can also ignore all major, minor, or patch releases for a dependency by adding an [`ignore` condition](https://docs.github.com/en/code-security/supply-chain-security/configuration-options-for-dependency-updates#ignore) with the desired `update_types` to your config file.

If you change your mind, just re-open this PR and I'll resolve any conflicts on it.

> Probably an inherit parameter

Please disregard the above (sorry, that's incorrect @bmarwell :)

Instead, move the section mentioning the checkstyle plugin from https://github.com/apache/shiro/blob/d627bf677a757de6c917e96024fbe46e07b34364/integration-tests/jakarta-ee/pom.xml#L472 to the `<plugin>` section of the root pom.
This will activate checkstyle at the root level, and as you might have guessed, break a lot of things because they don't conform to checkstyle rules :)
Those would need to be fixed as they come up.

Once again, thank you!
Yes, I caught the plugin management section. Oops.

@lprimak @bmarwell I hope you're having a nice day!
I moved the checkstyle to the root pom, and as it was expected... it broke a lot of things.
In the PR I added photos to show you the result of running `mvn verify`.
I'll be working on fixing some of the code that does not fulfill the checkstyle rules, and i'll commit those changes.

@lprimak @bmarwell Hi! It's me again. 
I've got a question...
There are some checkstyle rules errors related to magic number, such as:
**_\shiro\lang\src\main\java\org\apache\shiro\lang\codec\H64.java:53:29: '0xff' is a magic number. [MagicNumber]_**

```
private static short toShort(byte b) {
      return (short) (b & 0xff);
}
```
or

**_\shiro\lang\src\main\java\org\apache\shiro\lang\codec\H64.java:57:40: '4' is a magic number. [MagicNumber]_**

```
if (numBytes < 1 || numBytes > 4) {
    throw new IllegalArgumentException("numBytes must be between 1 and 4.");
}
```
Should I add variable to fix this magic numbers?

At the moment I just fixed easy checkstyle rules errors such as:

- `\shiro\lang\src\main\java\org\apache\shiro\lang\codec\CodecSupport.java:100:91: '+' should be on a new line. [OperatorWrap]`
- `\shiro\lang\src\main\java\org\apache\shiro\lang\codec\CodecSupport.java:184:82: '||' should be on a new line. [OperatorWrap]`
- `\shiro\lang\src\main\java\org\apache\shiro\lang\codec\CodecSupport.java:307:101: '+' should be on a new line. [OperatorWrap]`
- `\shiro\lang\src\main\java\org\apache\shiro\lang\codec\CodecSupport.java:308:105: '+' should be on a new line. [OperatorWrap]`
- `\shiro\lang\src\main\java\org\apache\shiro\lang\codec\CodecSupport.java:309:77: '+' should be on a new line. [OperatorWrap]`
- `\shiro\lang\src\main\java\org\apache\shiro\lang\codec\CodecSupport.java:310:104: '+' should be on a new line. [OperatorWrap]`
- `\shiro\lang\src\main\java\org\apache\shiro\lang\codec\CodecSupport.java:312:108: '+' should be on a new line. [OperatorWrap]`

I'll keep working on fixing checkstyle rules such as the listed before.

Have a nice day!

Couple of comments:
* Can you please make your PR draft until it's ready?

Here is the order of preference / priority for type of checkstyle-related fixes:
* Fix the code itself to conform to checkstyle
* Use `@SuppressWarnings` to ignore error
* Add a line to suppressions.xml
I left some comments on the PR, please continue there.
I would say for MagicNumber, `@SuppressWarnings` is the right thing to do

It's working with maven, you can take a look at the project sample here:

https://github.com/apache/shiro/blob/shiro-root-1.12.0/samples/web-jakarta/pom.xml

You need to use the classifier **jakarta** for the dependencies.

@fpapon I'm really not sure what you mean. I don't want the Jakarta version of Shiro, I want the old javax world. I updated the comment with a simple reproduction. This simple project doesn't compile on 1.12.0 but does on 1.11.0.
So you don't need the BOM for the javax namespace, the BOM is provided only for jakarta to avoid including non jakarta Shiro jar.
hm, that's unfortunate. Why not also provide a BOM for the non-jakarta version? It's still useful - allows me to not specify explicitly a version for all the Shiro dependencies.
Users never ask for that but if you think that it could be useful, feel free to create an issue to add this feature.
[Done!](https://github.com/apache/shiro/issues/1015).
If it was not so much work, I'd say use JSoup... but that may be for another day.
@boris-petrov are you sure that there was one for 1.11?  I don’t think anyone removed any BOM elements in 1.12 …

I thought about this a bit, and I am not sure how a BOM for non-jakarta (javax) artifacts would help.
The only reason there *is* a BOM for Jakarta is that every Shiro artifact has to have exclusions and needs to be individually included by application developer. In that specific case, BOM is very helpful and eases dependency inclusion.

However, for non-Jakarta (javax), all Shiro artifacts have their dependencies included already as transitive,
so there is no need to include all of them, just the most high-level one you use.

What do you think? Can you give a specific example (reproducer?) where a BOM would be actually useful?

Ok, I think we are going in circles here... I am going to reopen your original issue.
It's clear that you don't need a non-Jakarta BOM and trying to figure out some specific poblem you are having.
